articles.title: Revolutionizing Paleontology: The First Dinosaur Eggs Were Not What We Expected - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A recent study on the newly discovered Qianlong shouhu, an early Jurassic sauropodomorph, suggests that the earliest dinosaur eggs had leathery shells. This finding, derived from comprehensive analyses of dinosaur fossils, indicates significant evolutionary c…
articles.content:

The discovery of Qianlong shouhu, a new dinosaur species, has led to the revelation that the first dinosaur eggs were likely leathery. This contributes… [+7561 chars]
